did.abstract: Dr. Frank Goldsmith is the Director, Occupational Health for Transport Workers Union, Local 100. The Frank Goldsmith Papers (dated approximately 2002-2016) consists of materials created and collected by Goldsmith documenting his activities related to occupational health and safety and international labor organizing, with particular emphasis on his engagement with Transport Workers Union Local 100 in New York City. Materials related to TWU Local 100 include meeting agendas, memoranda, research notes and articles, and New York State Public Employment Board opinions and awards related to the unions collective bargaining agreement and campaigns to improve occupational health and safety. Materials related to the World Federation of Trade Unions and international labor organizing include newsletters, news articles, and conference materials. This collection also includes training and workshop materials for courses taught by Goldsmith, many of which were offered through the Murphy Institute at the CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies.
did.langmaterial: The majority of these materials are in English; some materials related to the World Federation of Trade Unions are in other languages.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Frank Goldsmith in May 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.074.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level. One born-digital object was identified, physically separated, and inventoried, but has not yet been forensically imaged, analyzed, or described. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
